Could I get someone who knows about decidability to review
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/9995#discussion_r746999324
before I take the bors d+ on this?
I'll try to remember to look tomorrow if someone doesn't beat me to it

Arguably we should remove the decidable_eq argument from direct_sum.submodule_is_internal (in another PR) and use the classical instance in the definition; it would introduce some converts or a need for direct_sum.submodule_is_internal.mk in the places that have this as the conclusion, but would remove the burden of decidability from the things consuming it. The latest change in the PR looks fine to me though
I think that mk lemma that takes a decidable_eq instance is better than convert.
